actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

official_title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit individuals, who are entitled to medicare benefits because of the receipt of child's insurance benefits but who would otherwise lose such entitlement due only to marriage, to purchase medicare coverage.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends part A (Hospital Insurance) of title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to permit individuals to purchase coverage under such part if they would be entitled to child's insurance benefits under title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Act were it not for their marriage.

titles.title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit individuals, who are entitled to medicare benefits because of the receipt of child's insurance benefits but who would otherwise lose such entitlement due only to marriage, to purchase medicare coverage.
